page.title: 15Ecology: Animals (2)
page.content:
Pheasants, both species of partridge, wood pigeons, lapwings, starlings, linnets and yellowhammers are common on the arable land. Regular summer breeders are cuckoos, turtle doves and yellow wagtails. Flocks of fieldfares and redwings overwinter on the fields. Green and spotted woodpeckers, magpies, tree creepers, as well as great, blue and long-tailed tits occur in trees and hedges.
The kestrel is the commonest diurnal raptor; tawny owls, the most frequently heard at night, though short-eared, little and barn owls occur.
These species are typical of the fen; the common garden species, as well as swallows, swifts and house martins, are also present.
